_header: God that all hast made of nought / For love of man
_description: ‘A confessioun of wyrschip i orysoun’ — eight couplets

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
God þat al hast mad of nouhtffor loue of mon þat þou
                    hast bouht…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…I preie þe lord þat þou me wisseAnd bring me
                    to þi muchele blisse. Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 1.
EETS
         o.s. 98 (1892; repr. 1973): 32.

BLAdd37787.First Lines:
God þat al hast made of noughtffor loue of man þat
                    þu hast bought…
BLAdd37787.Last Lines:
…I prey þe lord þu me wysseAnd bringe me to þi
                    muchel blisse
BLAdd37787.Editions:
Baugh,  Nita Scudder. 
             A Worcestershire Miscellany, compiled by John
                    Northwood, c. 1400, edited from British Museum MS. Add.
                37,787.
         Philadelphia, 1956: 96.
